thread.title: College football preview: Hardin-Simmons at Trinity
thread.title_full: College football preview: Hardin-Simmons at Trinity - San Antonio Express-News

author: Tom Orsborn
title: College football preview: Hardin-Simmons at Trinity
text:
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Trinity’s Jai Boatman tackles Howard Payne’s Tracy Morrison during first half action Saturday Sept. 6, 2014 at Trinity Football Stadium.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Trinity’s Jai Boatman tackles Howard Payne’s Tracy Morrison... College football preview: Hardin-Simmons at Trinity 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Hardin-Simmons (3-0) at Trinity (4-0)
Kickoff: 1 p.m. Saturday, Trinity Football Stadium
Radio: trinitytigers.com
Series: HSU leads 19-7-4.
Matchup: HSU offense vs. Trinity defense — Ranked 18th in this week’s D3football.com poll after amassing 600 yards of offense in last week’s 49-7 thrashing of Wayland Baptist, the Cowboys rank fifth in Division III in scoring offense at 53.3 points per game. Trinity, which beat Pacific Lutheran 23-13 last week on the road to improve to 4-0 for the first time since 2011, yields just 11.8 points per game to rank 19th nationally in scoring defense.
Players: HSU QB Weston Garner — Leads the nation in yards per pass attempt (13.1), passing efficiency (227.5) and is third in completion percentage (76.4); Trinity DB Jai Boatman — Tied for second nationally in interceptions with four.
Hardin-Simmons can win if: Garner duplicates last season’s performance against Trinity in which he passed for 220 yards and four TDs to lead the Cowboys to 42-17 win over the Tigers in Abilene.
Trinity can win if: It continues to win the turnover battle. The Tigers own a plus-10 turnover margin and have recorded 17 takeaways.
Fun with numbers: Seven different Cowboys have recorded a sack this season and all four starting defensive linemen have at least four tackles for loss.
